title: 109_hr3514
content: The Act may be cited as the "Surface Transportation Extension Act of 2005, Part VI" and pertains to administrative expenses for the Federal-aid highway program. SEC. 2. ADMINISTRATIVE EXPENSES FOR FEDERAL-AID HIGHWAY PROGRAM: Authorization of contract authority increased to $309,260,880. Limitation on obligations for administrative expenses set at $17,080,960 for the period of July 30, 2005, through August 14, 2005. Conforming amendment changes date to August 14. SEC. 3. ADMINISTRATIVE EXPENSES FOR NATIONAL HIGHWAY TRAFFIC SAFETY ADMINISTRATION. The Highway Trust Fund provides $4,125,000 for administrative expenses of the National Highway Traffic Administration for various highway safety programs and initiatives. These funds are available for obligation in the same manner as apportioned funds under title 23, United States Code. Funds provided for administrative expenses of the National Highway Traffic Administration are available for obligation in the same manner as apportioned funds under title 23, United States Code, with funds remaining available until expended. SEC. 4 amends the Surface Transportation Extension Act of 2004 by increasing administrative expenses for the Motor Carrier Safety Administration program. SEC. 5 addresses administrative expenses for Federal Transit Programs. SEC. 5 amends the authorization of appropriations and obligation ceiling for Federal Transit Programs, changing dates and funding amounts. SEC. 6 amends the funding amount for the Bureau of Transportation Statistics and specifies the limitation on obligations for administrative expenses. SEC. 7 extends the authorization for the use of trust funds for obligations under TEA-21. SEC. 6 amends the funding amount for the Bureau of Transportation Statistics and specifies the limitation on obligations for administrative expenses. SEC. 7 extends the authorization for the use of trust funds for obligations under TEA-21. Amendment to the Highway Trust Fund includes changes to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 related to payments authorized under the Surface Transportation Extension Act of 2005. Amendment to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 changes the Surface Transportation Extension Act of 2005, Part V to Part VI, with adjustments to the mass transit account deadline from July 31, 2005, to August 15, 2005. Amendment to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 changes the Surface Transportation Extension Act of 2005, Part V to Part VI, with adjustments to the mass transit account deadline from July 31, 2005, to August 15, 2005. Additionally, there are amendments to the Aquatic Resources Trust Fund related to the Sport Fish Restoration Account. The Transportation Extension Act of 2005, Part VI changes the deadline for the mass transit account from July 31, 2005, to August 15, 2005. Amendments are made to the Aquatic Resources Trust Fund related to the Sport Fish Restoration Account. From the date of the Surface Transportation Extension Act of 2003 until August 14, 2005, the Secretary of the Treasury will extend expiring provisions related to Highway Trust Fund appropriations and maintain tax rates as of the enactment date. The Surface Transportation Extension Act of 2003 maintains tax rates as of its enactment date. Certain temporary provisions of the Internal Revenue Code are repealed, with effective dates specified. SEC. 8. TECHNICAL AMENDMENT. Effective on the date of enactment of the Safe, Accountable, Flexible, Efficient Transportation Equity Act: A Legacy for Users, section 1942 of such Act is repealed.
